column1: Topic title: Nepali workers Fall from 23th floor MACC building

column8: Nepali worker falls to his death at MACC building sitePUTRAJAYA: A Nepali worker was killed instantly after falling at the construction site of the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) building in Presint 7 here.Bhim Bahadur Katuwal, 31, was believed to have fallen from either the 17th or 23rd floor of the building at about 8.50am Friday.He landed on another worker, a Bangladeshi who was in a suspended scaffolding, on the ground floor.Putrajaya OCPD Asst Comm Rosly Hassan said Bhim's left leg was severed in the fall and he died from serious head injuries.“We believe Bhim fell from either the 17th floor or the rooftop on the 23rd floor, because only these two levels had open spaces.“He landed on a Bangladeshi colleague, who was working inside the suspended scaffolding.“The scaffolding was still on the ground at the time of the incident,” he said.ACP Rosly said the 45-year-old Bangladeshi worker broke his right arm and was treated at Hospital Putrajaya, where Bhim’s body was sent for post-mortem.sos
